page.title: 15THE RAILWAY IN GOXHILL.
page.content: The Cleethorpes, Grimsby, Barton on Humber railway line passes through the village. Except for a signalman the station is unmanned. On weekdays there are 14 passenger trains a day in each direction. There are plans to shut the line on Sundays in the winter as so few people use it. The line has declined with the closure of the ferry at New Holland. A few goods trains going to and from the Brit Ag fertilizer factory at Barton use the line and it is perhaps this traffic that prevents the line coming under more serious threat of closure. The line is supported by the County Council as part of the Humberlink service using bus and rail to link Hull and Grimsby. Goxhill station is a scene of derilection although the station house is now a privately owned museum of railway memorabilia.
